Color: Gold to Dark Chestnut or Brown
Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Caramel, Toffee
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are not perceived. Hop bitterness is low.
Fermentation Characteristics: Diacetyl and sulfur are acceptable at very low levels.

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Toasted, biscuit-like, and/or bready malt flavors along with low levels of fermented-malt-derived sulfur compounds may be evident
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are low to medium-low, deriving from noble-type hops. Hop bitterness is medium
Fermentation Characteristics: Low levels of fermentation-derived sulfur compounds may be evident. Very low levels of diacetyl and DMS flavors may be perceived

Color: Deep Copper to Very Dark Brown
Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Caramel, Chocolate, Toast
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are low to medium. Hop bitterness is medium to high

Color: Light Reddish Brown to Very Dark
Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Dominated by a smooth, balanced sweet maltiness. Will also have a medium degree of malty, caramel-like aroma and flavor
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are not perceived. Hop bitterness is low but perceptible
Fermentation Characteristics: Yeast characters such as diacetyl and sulfur are acceptable at very low levels

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Varies
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Varies

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Bittersweet Chocolate, Cocoa, Coffee
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are medium-high to high, with floral, citrus and/or herbal hop aromas. Hop bitterness is medium-high to very high and balanced with the malt character

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Grainy
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: None
Fermentation Characteristics: Horsey, leathery or earthy flavors contributed by Brettanomyces yeasts may be evident but have a very low profile, as this beer is not excessively aged

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: No roasted barley or strong burnt/black malt character should be perceived. Medium malt, caramel and cocoa-like sweetness is present
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are low to medium-high. Hop bitterness is medium-low to medium

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Bready or grainy, with a distinct sweet maltiness and a chocolate-like character from roasted malt
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are not perceived. Hop bitterness is low
Fermentation Characteristics: The phenolic flavors of Dunkel Weissbier should be evident but subdued

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Light malt sweetness is present in the flavor. Bread, toast, biscuit and wheat flavors are common.
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma is low to medium-low, present but not dominant. Hop bitterness is low to medium-low.

Color: Hued with color reflecting the choice of fruit
Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Sweet malt characters are not perceived
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma, flavor and bitterness are not perceived to very low, and can include cheesy or floral lavender notes

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Roasted malt aromas including a cocoa-like character are acceptable at low levels. A very low degree of malt sweetness may be present
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor:
Hop aroma and flavor are not perceived. Hop bitterness is perceived to be very low to 
medium-low
Fermentation Characteristics: Some versions may be more highly carbonated and, when bottle-conditioned, may appear cloudy when served

Color: Deep Copper to Very Dark Brown
Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Caramel, Chocolate, Toast
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are low to medium. Hop bitterness is medium to high

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Bittersweet Chocolate, Cocoa, Coffee
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are medium-high to high, with floral, citrus and/or herbal hop aromas. Hop bitterness is medium-high to very high and balanced with the malt character

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Varies
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Varies

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Grainy
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Low

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Varies
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Varies

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Malt character is medium to high
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop flavor and aroma are very high, should be fresh and lively and should not be harsh in quality, deriving from any variety of hops. Hop bitterness is very high but not harsh

Color: Very Deep Ruby or Garnet to Black
Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Distinctive malt aromas of caramelized sugars, licorice, and chocolate-like notes of roasted malts and dark sugars are present. Roasted dark malts sometimes contribute a coffee-like roasted barley aroma. Low smoky aroma from malt may be evident. Debittered roasted malts are best used for this style
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are very low. Hop bitterness is low to medium-low
Fermentation Characteristics: Diacetyl and DMS flavors should not be apparent

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Malt flavor is low but provides foundation for the overall balance
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma is low to medium. Hop bitterness is medium to medium-high
Fermentation Characteristics: A small amount of sour or acidic flavor is acceptable when in balance with other components. These beers are often bottle-conditioned, with some yeast character and high carbonation

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Caramel, dark sugar and malty sweet flavors and aromas can be intense, not cloying, while complementing fruitiness
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are not perceived to very low. Hop bitterness is low to medium-low
Fermentation Characteristics: Clove-like phenolic flavor and aroma should not be evident

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Not Perceived
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are not perceived. Hop bitterness is not perceived to very low

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Caramel, Toast
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are low but noticeable; noble-type hops are commonly used. Hop bitterness is low but noticeable

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Chocolate, Caramel, Toast
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are not perceived to low. Hop bitterness is medium-low to medium
Fermentation Characteristics: Slight yeast haze is often evident when bottle-conditioned

Color: Deep Golden to Copper or Light Brown
Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Biscuit, Bready, Caramel
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: High, exhibiting ﬂoral, fruity, onion-garlic-, catty, citrusy, piney or resinous character associated with American-variety hops.Hop bitterness is medium to medium-high

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Bready, wheat, honey-like and/or caramel malt aromas are often present
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are low to medium. Hop bitterness is medium to medium-high

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Reminiscent of bitter chocolate or coffee. Malt sweetness is low to medium, and incorporates mild roasted malt character without the associated bitterness
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are very low to low, deriving from noble-type hops. Hop bitterness is low to medium

Color: Deep Golden to Copper or Light Brown
Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Biscuit, Bready, Caramel
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: High, exhibiting ﬂoral, fruity, onion-garlic-, catty, citrusy, piney or resinous character associated with American-variety hops.Hop bitterness is medium to medium-high

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: These beers can be malty in overall impression, or dry and highly attenuated
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are medium-low to medium-high. Hop bitterness is medium-low to medium-high
Fermentation Characteristics: Diacetyl should be very low, if evident

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Aroma should have a notable degree of toasted and/or slightly roasted malt character. Malt flavor is slightly sweet
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma, flavor and bitterness are very low to low

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Medium caramel malt and dark roasted malt aromas are evident
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma is medium-high to high, with hops of all origins contributing fruity, floral, herbal or other notes

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Malt sweetness, chocolate, and caramel should dominate the flavor profile. Malt bitterness is low to medium-low and derived from roasted malt or barley
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are not perceived. Hop bitterness is low to medium-low and serves to balance and suppress some of the sweetness without contributing apparent flavor nor aroma

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: A malty and sometimes caramel-like sweetness may be evident.
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are not perceived to medium. Hop bitterness is minimal but evident.
Fermentation Characteristics: Diacetyl is acceptable at very low levels.

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Malt sweetness, chocolate, and caramel should dominate the flavor profile. Malt bitterness is low to medium-low and derived from roasted malt or barley
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are not perceived. Hop bitterness is low to medium-low and serves to balance and suppress some of the sweetness without contributing apparent flavor nor aroma

Clarity: Brilliant (but haze may exist from yeast sediment from bottle fermentation)
Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Sweet malt characters are not perceived
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma, flavor and bitterness are not perceived to very low, and can include cheesy or floral lavender notes
Fermentation Characteristics: Characteristic horsey, goaty, leathery and phenolic aromas derived from Brettanomyces yeast are often present at moderate levels

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: No roasted barley or strong burnt/black malt character should be perceived. Medium malt, caramel and cocoa-like sweetness is present
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are low to medium-high. Hop bitterness is medium-low to medium

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Malt sweetness is very low to medium-low
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop flavor is not perceived to very low. Hop bitterness is very low

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas are prominent. Caramel-like and chocolate-like roasted malt aroma should be evident
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are optional, but should not overpower the overall balance if present. Hop bitterness is medium
Fermentation Characteristics: Diacetyl should be absent or at extremely low levels

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Malt aroma and flavor are low
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop flavor and aroma are not perceived to low. Hop bitterness is very low to low

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Malt character is sometimes bread-like, yet always reminiscent of freshly and very lightly toasted malted barley
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma is not perceived to low. Hop flavor and bitterness are very low to low, deriving from European noble-type hops

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Low sweetness from very pale malts is present
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are not perceived to low. Hop bitterness is medium to medium-high
Fermentation Characteristics: Traditional tripels are bottle-conditioned and may exhibit slight yeast haze, but the yeast should not be intentionally roused

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Black malt character can be perceived in some porters, while others may be absent of strong roasted character. Medium to high malt sweetness, caramel and chocolate are acceptable
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are not perceived to medium. Hop bitterness is medium to medium-high

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Low to medium residual malt sweetness is present
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma may be evident at the brewer's discretion
Fermentation Characteristics: Low-level diacetyl aromas and flavor are acceptable

Color: Hued with color reflecting the choice of fruit
Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Sweet malt characters are not perceived
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma, flavor and bitterness are not perceived to very low, and can include cheesy or floral lavender notes

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Nutmeg, vanilla, caramel, plums, prunes, raisins, grapes and cocoa, with rum and brandy flavors to boot. Medium malty sweetness is present. If dark, a mild roasted malt aroma and flavor should emerge
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma is not perceived. Hop bitterness is low
Fermentation Characteristics: If served with yeast, appearance may appropriately be very cloudy

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Grainy
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: None
Fermentation Characteristics: Horsey, leathery or earthy flavors contributed by Brettanomyces yeasts may be evident but have a very low profile, as this beer is not excessively aged

Color: Dark Brown (may have red tint) to Very Dark
Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Nutty, Chocolate, Caramel, Bready, Toffee
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are not perceived to medium. Hop bitterness is medium

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Light malt sweetness is present in the flavor. Bread, toast, biscuit and wheat flavors are common.
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma is low to medium-low, present but not dominant. Hop bitterness is low to medium-low.

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Malt sweetness is very low to medium-low
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop flavor is not perceived to very low. Hop bitterness is very low

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Chocolate, Caramel, Toast
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are not perceived to low. Hop bitterness is medium-low to medium
Fermentation Characteristics: Slight yeast haze is often evident when bottle-conditioned

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Residual malt and defining sweetness is medium to medium-high
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop flavor is medium to medium-high. Hop bitterness is medium to medium-high

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Balance ranges from dry to sweet maltiness. Roast malt tones of toffee, nuts and caramel sometimes contribute to the flavor profile
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor is very low. Hop bitterness is very low to low
Fermentation Characteristics: Diacetyl should be very low, if evident

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Dry stouts achieve a dry-roasted character through the use of roasted barley. Initial malt and light caramel flavors give way to a distinctive dry-roasted bitterness in the finish. Emphasis of coffee-like roasted barley and a moderate degree of roasted malt flavors define much of the character
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are are not perceived to low, from European-type hops. Hop bitterness is medium to medium high
Fermentation Characteristics: Diacetyl should be very low, if evident

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Low to medium malt sweetness with low to medium caramel, chocolate, and/or roasted coffee flavor is present, with a distinctive dry-roasted bitterness in the finish. The contribution of roasted barley and roasted malt to astringency is low and not excessive. Slight roasted malt acidity is acceptable
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are medium to high, often with American citrus-type and/or resiny hop aromas. Hop bitterness is medium to high

Color: Amber to Deep Red or Copper-Garnet
Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Caramel, Toffee, Bready, Sweet
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are medium to very high. Hop bitterness is high. American-type hops are often used, but not necessary for this style
Fermentation Characteristics: Very low levels of diacetyl may be acceptable

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Bittersweet Chocolate, Cocoa, Coffee
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are medium-high to high, with floral, citrus and/or herbal hop aromas. Hop bitterness is medium-high to very high and balanced with the malt character

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Pronounced aromas and flavors of toasted malted barley. Some caramel and toffee character can contribute to complexity in a secondary role. Dark fruit flavors such as prune and raisin may be present. Malty sweetness is pronounced but should not be cloying. There should be no astringency from roasted malts.
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma should be absent. Hop flavor and bitterness are low

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Noticeable caramel-type malt flavor should be present
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop flavor is low to medium-low and may present as Woody, Rustic, or Minty. Hop bitterness is medium to medium-high

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Low to medium residual malt sweetness is present
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma may be evident at the brewer's discretion
Fermentation Characteristics: Low-level diacetyl aromas and flavor are acceptable

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Malt flavor is low but provides foundation for the overall balance
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma is low to medium. Hop bitterness is medium to medium-high
Fermentation Characteristics: A small amount of sour or acidic flavor is acceptable when in balance with other components. These beers are often bottle-conditioned, with some yeast character and high carbonation

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Dry stouts achieve a dry-roasted character through the use of roasted barley. Initial malt and light caramel flavors give way to a distinctive dry-roasted bitterness in the finish. Emphasis of coffee-like roasted barley and a moderate degree of roasted malt flavors define much of the character
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are are not perceived to low, from European-type hops. Hop bitterness is medium to medium high
Fermentation Characteristics: Diacetyl should be very low, if evident

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: The dominant flavor is of pale malt sweetness at medium-low to medium levels. Caramel malt attributes should be absent.
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma is usually absent, and hop flavor is very low to low. Hop bitterness is very low to low
Fermentation Characteristics: Fermentation-derived sulfur character and/or DMS flavor should be extremely low or absent from this style of beer. Diacetyl flavor should not be perceived

Color: Inclusion of rye can create a wide range of color. Lighter versions: Straw to Copper. Darker versions: Dark Amber to Dark Brown
Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: In darker versions, malt aromas can optionally include low roasted malt characters evident as cocoa/chocolate or caramel, and/or aromatic toffee-like, caramel, or biscuit-like characters
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop flavor and aroma are low to medium-high. Hop bitterness is low to medium
Fermentation Characteristics: In versions served with yeast, appearance may range from hazy to very cloudy

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas are prominent. Caramel-like and chocolate-like roasted malt aroma should be evident
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are optional, but should not overpower the overall balance if present. Hop bitterness is medium
Fermentation Characteristics: Diacetyl should be absent or at extremely low levels

Color: Light Reddish Brown to Very Dark
Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Dominated by a smooth, balanced sweet maltiness. Will also have a medium degree of malty, caramel-like aroma and flavor
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop aroma and flavor are not perceived. Hop bitterness is low but perceptible
Fermentation Characteristics: Yeast characters such as diacetyl and sulfur are acceptable at very low levels

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: Residual malt and defining sweetness is medium to medium-high
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop flavor is medium to medium-high. Hop bitterness is medium to medium-high

Perceived Malt Aroma & Flavor: High malt character with aromas of toasted or nut-like malt, but not caramel
Perceived Hop Aroma & Flavor: Hop flavor is low. Hop bitterness is perceived as medium, increasing proportionately with starting gravity
